questions.question: Which is the most effective way to have labels for different street types be shown at different scale ranges?
questions.answer: Create a separate layer for each street type
correctAnswer: Create a separate layer for each street type
options: Use the **Draw** toolbar to create text boxes for each street type
Create label classes for each type of street
Create a separate layer for each street type
This is not possible. Labels are the same at all scale ranges

questions.question: In ArcGIS Pro, what are the two viewing modes for scenes?
When an ArcMap .mxd file is imported into ArcGIS Pro, what is each data frame in the original document converted to in the ArcGIS Pro project?
Which is a collection of raster datasets stored as a catalog that allows you to view or access the datasets as a single merged image or individual images?
options: a folder of raster data files

questions.question: Using the explore tool in ArcGIS Pro, how do you zoom in and out of the map?
questions.answer: Move the mouse scroll wheel forward to zoom out and backward to zoom in.
correctAnswer: Move the mouse scroll wheel forward to zoom out and backward to zoom in.
options: Press shift and left-click to zoom in. Press ctrl and left-click to zoom out.
Hold the left mouse button, and drag up to zoom in and drag down to zoom out.
Move the mouse scroll wheel forward to zoom out and backward to zoom in.
Click and drag a box with the left mouse button to zoom in; press shift and drag a box to zoom out.

questions.question:
Which Layer in this map is currently not visible in the data frame?
![Which Layer in this map is currently not visible in the data frame?](images/Q6.png)
When you zoom in on a map, how are you changing the view
questions.answer: from a lower scale to a higher scale
correctAnswer: from a lower scale to a higher scale
options: from a higher scale to a lower scale
from a smaller scale to a larger scale
from a lower scale to a higher scale
from a larger scale to a smaller scale

questions.question: Where are parcel fabrics, geometric networks, and topologies created?
Which of these methods is best for sharing a map with colleagues who do not have ArcMap or ArcGis Pro?
questions.answer: Publish the map as a service and then create a web map that you can share with your colleagues
correctAnswer: Publish the map as a service and then create a web map that you can share with your colleagues
options: Export the map to PDF and send your colleagues the PDF.
Export the map to KML and ask your colleagues to download Google Earth.
Publish the map as a service and then create a web map that you can share with your colleagues
Export the map to a map package, and ask your colleagues to download and install the free Map Package Viewer software

questions.question: You built a model and verified that it works as intended by running it on your own data files. What is the best way to share the entire procedure with colleagues so that they can study it, reproduce your results exactly, and then apply the model to their own data?
options: Convert the model to Python and upload the results to ArcGIS Online as a service.
Run the consolidated Model tool to gather the model and input datasets into a shared folder

questions.question: Which is an example of geographic coordinate system?
When you create a bookmark of your current map view, what is being saved?
questions.answer: the map's current scale and center point
correctAnswer: the map's current scale and center point
options: the map's current scale and center point
the visibility status of each layer
the center point of the current view

questions.question:
What geoprocessing tool, when applied to the Point Data Layer, is most likely responsible for the data shown in the Result Layer?
![What geoprocessing tool, when applied to the Point Data Layer, is most likely responsible for the data shown in the Result Layer?](images/Q13.png)
By default, as what do all geoprocessing tools run from dialog boxes execute?
A grayscale raster is said to have a single \***\*\_\*\*** while a full-color RGB raster has three \***\*\_\*\***.
Which Classification method places approximately the same number of values in each class \***\*\_\*\***.
You want to add a time and date to your map layout that will update when the map is printed. What element should you add to do this ? \***\*\_\*\***.
Linear referencing datasets are comprised of what two data types? \***\*\_\*\***.
questions.answer: route feature classes and event tables
correctAnswer: route feature classes and event tables
options: polyline feature classes and point location tables
line event tables and point event tables
reference control points feature class and target tables
route feature classes and event tables

questions.question: How can you link the size of text and symbols to a specific zoom level of the map so that they increase and decrease in size as you zoom in and out? \***\*\_\*\***.
questions.answer: In the **Layer Properties** dialog box, click **Display**, and then clear **Fixed Sizing**
correctAnswer: In the **Layer Properties** dialog box, click **Display**, and then clear **Fixed Sizing**
options: Right click the map in the **Contents** pane and click **Set Reference Scale**.
Right click the data layer and choose **Symbology > Variable**.
Turn on the option for **Zoom Symbology and Labels** in the map's properties.
In the **Layer Properties** dialog box, click **Display**, and then clear **Fixed Sizing**

questions.question: When trying to publish a web feature layer from ArcGIS Pro to ArcGIS Online, the analyzer returns the error message "Layer uses an unsupported renderer or property." Which symbology method would cause this error?
Which data source cannot be added to ArcGIS Online to be used as a hosted feature layer?
questions.answer: Google Sheets spreadhssts stored in Google Drive
correctAnswer: Google Sheets spreadhssts stored in Google Drive
options: Google Sheets spreadhssts stored in Google Drive

questions.question: You need to attach photographs to a geodatabase feature class called `Bus_Stops`. To enable this capability using ArcCatalog, you right-click the `Bus_Stops` feature class, point to Manage, and then click **Create Attachments**. What does this create in the geodatabase?
questions.answer: A geodatabase table called `Bus_Stops_REL` is created that references a `Bus_Stops_ATTACHMENTS` folder in the same parent folder as the geodatabase
correctAnswer: A geodatabase table called `Bus_Stops_REL` is created that references a `Bus_Stops_ATTACHMENTS` folder in the same parent folder as the geodatabase
options: A geodatabase table called `Bus_Stops_REL` is created that references a `Bus_Stops_ATTACHMENTS` folder in the same parent folder as the geodatabase
A geodatabase table called `Bus_Stops_ATTACH` and a relationship class called `Bus_Stops_ATTACHREL` are created.
A feature class called `Bus_Stops_ATTACH` and a relationship class called `Bus_Stops_RELATION` are created.
A new raster feature dataset called `Bus_Stops_ATTACHMENTS` is created.

questions.question: A file geodatabase table field that will be used to store scans of historical records in `.pdf` format needs to be what data type?
You want to create a tool for your organization that will walk users through a best-practice workflow in a consistent manner. What is the best way to go about this?
options: Publish an ArcGIS Online story map.

questions.question: When creating a feature class, which field data type would be the most appropriate to store values in the expected range of 1,000 to 10,000?

If you are looking for all features containing a specific company name in the attribute table, but don't know the name of the column containing the company name, or even which layers it is in, which tool should you use to search all of the attributes in all of the layers at once?

You need to prepare an ArcGIS Online hosted feature layer that will be used to collect fire hydrant maintenance data using the Collector for ArcGIS mobile app. You would like Collector to display a drop-down menu of valid choices for the hydrant manufacturer attribute so that data can be entered with just a couple of taps, as pictured. How would you do this?
questions.answer: For the Manufacturer field, create the list of values as a coded-value domain.
correctAnswer: For the Manufacturer field, create the list of values as a coded-value domain.
options: Attach the list of values as a subtype of the Hydrant feature layer.
For the Manufacturer field, create the list of values as a range domain.
Create the list of values as default values for the feature layer.
For the Manufacturer field, create the list of values as a coded-value domain.
